title: A remake system that would actually work?
body:
Why can't we just have a remake system that the enemy team has to vote on? meaning if you're blue side you start the vote, red side then has to get 3-4/5 votes and if red side, blue has to do the same.

It probably won't happen as often as it should because of people being assholes and wanting free wins but its still better than nothing right and there is no real way to cheat the system or anything. Is there? I can't think of anything myself besides like knowing most of the enemy team somehow. Seems like a very tiny tiny percentage though compared to the upsides.

What does everyone else think? don't think it would be that hard to add in since it would be pretty much the same as surrender and seems like there would only be positives.

EDIT: new Idea. 

Ok firstly if you were confused this is an ADD ON to the already current remake system of having a DC at the start.

Now what if it was like this instead? The team remaking (lets say Blue side) has to first vote as group with majority (or all players which ever Riot feels necessary) to get the remake happening and a certain amount of time like 10-20 mins or something has to of passed. Then it is handed over to the enemy team (red side) where they now vote majority (or all players) for the remake to happen. Everyone on the blue side apart from disconnected players (They will get the same penalty as all disconnects) get no LP/MMR lost but everyone on the red side gets LP as if they had won the game. You can't really abuse this system yourself you have to rely on the enemy team. To stop the abuse pretty much completely you would make it only be able to happen when there is a disconnect on one of the teams like the system they have now.

This would actually get the enemy team to vote for it because they will be getting there LP, so how about this system?

replies.body: Did you even think this through? If the enemy team has only 4 people as if ANYONE would allow it. Its free LP for most people.

But its better than not having it isn't it? this is one of the only ways to have it that you can't just abuse it. Of course most people won't vote because they just want there free win but its still better than no remake after 3 mins right?

I get your point but WHO would EVER use it. Its a pointless feature. it would be better to allow remake if a player joins then dc's still being before 3 minutes OR connects but lags out BEFORE 3 minutes also and still allowing it.

Ok firstly if you were confused this is an ADD ON to the already current remake system of having a DC at the start. If you just think about please, there is no downside to this is there? Yes most people will not vote for it because they want the free win, but there will be some games where you actually don't get punished for a Disconnect.

What if it was like this instead? The team remaking (lets say Blue side) has to first vote as group with majority (or all players which ever Riot feels necessary) to get the remake happening, can only happen if the game has been played for 10-20 mins. Then it is handed over to the enemy team (red side) where they now vote majority (or all players) for the remake to happen. Everyone on the blue side apart from disconnected players (They will get the same penalty as all disconnects) get no LP/MMR lost but everyone on the red side gets LP as if they had won the game. You can't really abuse this system yourself you have to rely on the enemy team. To stop the abuse pretty much completely you would make it only be able to happen when there is a disconnect on one of the teams like the system they have now.

This would actually get the enemy team to vote for it because they will be getting there LP, so how about this system?
it what world would anyone say "oh you only have 4 people, sure we wont take the free win, here we vote for a draw". Helll nooo give me my LP.

Very few people would give up a free win. I probably wouldn't either. 

I don't understand how getting the enemy team to also vote in the remake would make it better? Surely it should just be the disadvantaged team being the ones to decide if they want to continue or not.
Im saying this as an add on to the remake when you have a DC right at the start of the game. This is just one way there would be no abuse and would save some people some games.
In case it wasn't already made clear, this is a terrible idea because 99.9999999% of teams will *not* let you leave a game where they have a direct advantage, like a 5v4.
Why does that make it a terrible game though, YES most people won't do it but there is no downside to it right? its literally just better than not having so idk why everyone is hating it.

The remake system has saved me coutless time and hair.

No,silly idea
Im not saying remove the current one im saying add in this one because there is literally no downside, yes it won't happen often but its better than nothing is it not?

regardless the enemy team shouldnt have to sit in lobby again for another 10 minutes waiting for a game, with some sort of reward. like half lp or something. there is no reason to not gain lp. in any other team game, if you dont have enough players you concede the win. that means the enemy gets the points for the win. if you want to be taken serisouyl take something out of the team game scene and give rewards to people that win. by forfeit or not.
